com.github.mathiewz.blockchain

Class Block<T extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mathiewz.blockchain.Block<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class of the data.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Block<T>>, Iterable<Block<T>>

    public class Block<T extends Serializable>
extends Object
implements Iterable<Block<T>>, Comparable<Block<T>>, Serializable
    A block containing some data. The data is stored in an object T It is chained with other blocks.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPrevious

        public Block<T> getPrevious()
        Return the previous block in the chain. If the current block is the first, it return itself.
        Returns:
        the previous block in the chain. If the current block is the first, it return itself.

      • isValid

        Returns:

        public boolean isWholeChainValid()
        Check if the whole chain is valid
        Returns:

      • compare

        public static <T extends Serializable> int compare(Block<T> firstChain,
                                                   Block<T> secondChain)
        Compare two blocks and return the best one. A block is better if it is valid and the bigger its index is.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the data contained in the two blocks
        Parameters:
        firstChain - the first blockchain to compare
        secondChain - the second blockchain to compare
        Returns:
        a negative value secondChain is better, a positive value if the firstChain is better, and 0 if it's not possible to determine which is the better chain.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(T object)
        Check if any block of the chain contains a data. It uses the method equals of T to check the equality.
        Parameters:
        object - the data to check
        Returns:
        true if any data in the chain is equals to the specified data.
